meanings.definition: In a manner showing resentment or injury
meanings.sent1: She looked at him aggrievedly when he broke her toy.
meanings.sent2: She spoke aggrievedly about the unfair treatment she received.
meanings.sent3: He pouted aggrievedly when his friend ate the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: The cat meowed aggrievedly after being scolded for scratching the furniture.
meanings.sent5: The child's face twisted aggrievedly as he was told he couldn't have any more candy.

meanings.sent1: The aggrievedly expression on her face showed she was upset.
meanings.sent2: He felt aggrievedly towards his boss for not giving him a raise.
meanings.sent3: The dog looked aggrievedly at the closed door, wanting to go outside.
meanings.sent4: The tree stood aggrievedly, its branches heavy with snow.
meanings.sent5: The student's aggrievedly attitude towards the test results was evident in his frown.
